definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: A lot of them were persecuted and tortured to death by their political opponents.
sentences.chinese: 许多人被他们的政敌迫害致死。

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他兴致勃勃地揭发政敌的贪污腐化。

sentences.english: His political opponents made a calculated attack on him.
sentences.chinese: 他的政敌们对他进行了包藏祸心的攻击。

sentences.english: Mr Obama has been teased by political  opponents in the past about his physique.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马之前就因体格问题遭到政敌们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: The Party has flung down a challenge to its political rivals to debate the issue on television.
sentences.chinese: 该政党向其政敌提出挑战，上电视去辩论这一问题。

sentences.english: But although he was among the first to confront Hitler, Litten remains a little-known figure.
sentences.chinese: 作为元首的政敌，他是第一批遭到逮捕的人之一。

sentences.english: This is a good chance to strike back your political opponent.
sentences.chinese: 这正是回击你的政敌的好机会。

sentences.english: Mr Obama has been teased by political opponents in the past about his physique.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马之前就因体格问题遭到政敌们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: Third, can the candidate tell the difference between a foreign enemy and a political opponent?
sentences.chinese: 第三，候选人能够搞清楚外敌和政敌的区别吗？

sentences.english: The politician tried to impute some unfortunate remarks to his enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这个政治家想把一些不当的言论转嫁到他的政敌身上。

sentences.english: He was driven from a position of power by his political enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他被他的政敌赶下了台。

sentences.english: Outside of Libya, Gaddafi will be remembered for his enmities.
sentences.chinese: 在利比亚之外，卡扎菲被所有的政敌铭记在心。

sentences.english: His political opponents broadsided the candidate.
sentences.chinese: 这位候选人的政敌猛烈抨击他。

sentences.english: He was among the first of the fuehrer's political opponents to be rounded up after the Nazis assumed power.
sentences.chinese: 作为元首的政敌，他是第一批遭到逮捕的人之一。

definition: to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
to accuse of misconduct (in official task)/to impeach
to frame/to bring false charges against
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
